In addition Clinton tried to cut wasteful spending. The plan was to get the deficit to be cut a little every year until it was gone and it worked. Message.Title: re: - ask the twit about his taxes...
Message.Msg: ... “Most of the voters on the right are wealthier than the left because they don’t pander to a voting bloc that doesn’t pay taxes, gets most of the food stamps, most of the welfare or are here illegally in the first place.” - jonwindandale You know, I can’t even begin to fathom WTF that asinine statement means. Okay, boys and girls, a lesson in Economics 101. If you don’t, I repeat, DO NOT “pander” to poor people, you WILL become rich. That’s how it works…simple as that. Read my lips…no new pandering. What exactly is “pandering” to someone, anyhow? And if we don’t know what pandering is, how do we NOT do it anymore? On the other hand, might we then assume that, rather than NOT pandering to poor people to become wealthy, if we pander to rich people, will we become poor? Is that how it works? Who do we have to “pander” to continue to be middle class? Ling-Ling or Hsing-Hsing? I had a friend who pandered poor people out of all their food stamps, cashed them in and opened an oriental restaurant, The Pander Buffet. It was very successful, and he became extremely wealthy, because he permitted no choices from column A and none from column B. For $12.95, you didn’t get any food except for a fortune cookie that said, “You’ve just been pandered by a demagogue.” “If they got better off financially, they might get educated enough to think with an open mind…” Oh, puleeeeese! The Republican party – the party of education? Sure. Uh, don’t you fools want to do away with the Department of Education and privatize the schools so you can assure only the wealthy get educated? Don’t you home school your kids in superstitious, anti-science mumbo-jumbo nonsense like creationism, while denying evolution, global warming, racial equality and anything based on empirical evidence? That’s really some “open mind.”

Message.Title: bleed, bleed, bleed,...drift, drift, drift....
Message.Msg: I'm long but I've seen this before with other stocks- esp. after a big run like T has had. A stock drifting down everyday and nobody thinks it's a big deal. 10 cents here, 25 cents there, 65 cents on a bad day... before you know it you go from $38 to $32 a little teeny bit at a time. All of a sudden your down over 15% ($38 to $32). This has that ugly feeling to me. $37 has now been broken for the first time in quite a while. T never has good days anymore. Long term (5-10 years) I'm not too concerned, but short term I see some real pain.

Topic.Title: ceo pay

Message.Msg: 26 Companies Paid CEOs > They Paid in Taxes By Barry Ritholtz - August 18th, 2012, 12:00PM Astonishing assembly of data, from AP via the Daily Mail: “Twenty-six big US companies paid their CEOs more last year than they paid the federal government in tax, according to a study released Thursday by a liberal-leaning think tank. The study, by the Institute for Policy Studies, said the companies, including AT&T, Boeing and Citigroup, paid their CEOs an average of $20.4 million last year while paying little or no federal tax on ample profits, according to regulatory filings. Astonishingly, nearly all of the the companies received a net tax refunds of up to $1billion. Others had a tax bill of $0. On average, the 26 companies generated net income of more than $1 billion in the US, the study said.” Taxes, why would we pay any stinking taxes . . . ? The Institute for Policy Studies lists these 26 companies that paid their CEOs more than they paid the federal government in taxes: Company CEO CEO pay Taxes Profits Abbott Laboratories Miles D White Message.Msg: UNBELIEVABLE THIEVERY Obama Daughters are Michelle's 'Senior Staffers' Michelle was caught cheating on her expense report. What a show of arrogance! This information was obtained by Judicial Watch March, 2012. The administration had to be sued to get this through the FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT. Michelle Obama listed daughters as 'Senior Staffers' to justify her expensive African vacation and safari. October 5, 2011, Judicial Watch said the U.S. Air Force provided a C-32 ( a Boeing 757 ), modified by the military for the purpose of flying big-wigs around the world, to fly the First Lady and her entourage to and from Africa , at a cost of $424,142. Another $928.44 was listed as ' bulk food' costs per meal for the 192 on board meals for the 21 people who made the trip. Lobster ain't cheap when you fly it around the world. The Obama daughters were listed on the manifest as senior staff. 'This trip was as much an opportunity for the Obama family to go on a safari as it was a trip to conduct government business,' said Judicial Watch President Tom Fitton. 'This junket wasted tax dollars and the resources of our over extended military. No wonder we had to sue to pry loose this information .' The nation is suffering with the economy sputtering, the national debt soaring and Obama's economic rescue policies not only failing, but actively making things worse. Meanwhile, the First Lady justifies an expensive trip to Africa to take a vacation and safari with her daughters by saying it's 'official business' and even going so far as to list her children as staffers. The level of arrogance and dishonesty on display here is nothing short of shocking. But, er, 'hope for change' and yes we can. It's a true story. Check out this link and read it yourself: http://www.judicialwatch.org/press-room/press-releases/judicial-watch-obtains-documents-detailing-the-cost-to-taxpayers-for-michelle-obama-s-family-trip-to-africa/

Topic.Title: ceo pay

Message.Msg: You're getting paid to do a job, why do you think all excessive profit must go to you? It is the stockholder's money! Don't like it, start your own company!

Topic.Title: WE NEED HELP

Message.Msg: Jimmy, every person including yourself has a share of this new debt which equals $61,000 per person. Can't you do something before the US turns into the Roman Empire? Maybe it's too late but we have one more shot to prevent this from happening in Nov....

Topic.Title: ceo pay

Message.Msg: "Don't like it, start your own company!" Exactly, and according to Obama all he needs to make it happen is Obama.

Message.Title: Apple, Now There's A Joke! Can You Say 'Manipulation?'
Message.Msg: That's why I don't invest in the racket they've got going. What a joke. Are we expected to believe "the numbers" when even the SEC didn't detect Lehman's $50 BILLION money shift to the U.K. right under their noses just before the collapse that almost brought the world's economy down? Apple? C'mon, a joke. I think one day it will be discovered that Apple was losing money all this time. By who and when remains to be seen, imo.

Message.Title: re: separation of church and hate...
Message.Msg: ... Once again, jon, you make absolutely no sense, whatsoever. WTF are you even talking about? Did you somehow smoke your dinner salad? “Separation of Church and State…this should settle any debate…” Who’s debating about separation of church and state? Jerry Falwell? Billy Graham? Pat Robertson? Bob Jones? Joel Osteen? Oral “Hygiene” Roberts? You’re suddenly suggesting that your Tea Party mentality is for separation of church and state. Sure they are…On the contrary – you think Secular Humanists are Disciples of the Devil. “Tea Party supporters are typically: white and unfriendly toward immigrants and blacks, as well as self reportingly ‘deeply religious.’ Tea Party supporters typically want religion in government. They approve of religious leaders engaging in politics and political leaders engaging in religion. Despite using the Constitution in their talk they have little or no sympathy for the Constitutional Principle of Separation of Church & State.” (Putnam & Campbell, American Grace) “…of anyone of this statute (sic) soliciting any Clergy…? Yes, Statute # 1704, Revised Code of Lunacy, states specifically, “Tea Party bloggers and sign painters must at all times demonstrate complete incompetence in spelling, sentence structure, grammar and any other outward signs of intellectual curiosity. Dressing funny and looking goofy is also recommended, but optional. Tee Partyers Untie
